The Death Metal Detector

Naive Bayes & Heavy Metal Culture

Death metal is an extreme subgenre of heavy metal music...played with techniques such as...deep growling vocals; aggressive, powerful drumming, featuring double kick and blast beat techniques... The lyrical themes of death metal may include slasher film-style violence, political conflict, religion, nature, philosophy, true crime and science fiction.

Wikipedia, Death Metal

Death Metal lyrics have a certain edge to them above and beyond what Ozzy Osbourne was doing in the 70s. I suspected that Death Metal might use a unique and detectable "language" even when the subject of a song is something other than a horror movie synopsis.

Based on this hypothesis, I built The Death Metal Detector. It's a Complement Naive Bayes machine learning model, trained on TF-IDF transformed data on over 200,000 songs. This "scores" the lyrics you give it on a scale from 0% to 100%.

Technically, this score represents the model's confidence in identifying the song as Death Metal. However, I prefer to call it the song's "brutality" score, based on a common adjective that fans use to describe their favorite Death Metal songs.

It also reflects how the model treats songs Death Metal's relatives. Genre staples like Cannibal Corpse or Morbid Angel usually +95% confidence. Classic heavy metal like Ozzy or Iron Maiden, brutal in its own right but not to the same degree, usually scores in the 60-80% range. Non-metal acts like Taylor Swift will barely move the needle.

Try it out below! Copy/paste lyrics from your favorite songs, or come up with your own gutteral incantations and see if they're worthy!
